title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Health Education Specialists

content.rendered:
What is a Health Education Specialist?

Health Education Specialists use their knowledge of health and wellness to help individuals and communities better their lifestyles. 

Where does a Health Education Specialist work?

  • Hospitals
  • Clinics
  • Government
  • Schools and universities

How much does a Health Education Specialist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Health Education Specialist is $43,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Health Education Specialists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Health sciences majors
  • Social work majors
Search Health Education Specialist jobs

Health Education Specialist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Health Education Specialists succeed in their work:

  • Great interpersonal skills
  • Desire to educate
  • Good communication skills

What are some common questions about Health Education Specialists?

Q: What makes a good health educator?

A: Besides having a strong background in technical knowledge, enthusiasm to educate others and great interpersonal skills are key.
